section.section: This paragraph does not apply to a Class EF license issued under § 6-201 of this article.

In Cecil County, notwithstanding any other provisions of this subtitle, the hours during which sales of any alcoholic beverages may be made under any class of license issued under this article on any day, Monday through Saturday, are from 6 a.m. to 2 a.m. the following day.

It is unlawful for any person to sell or for any person to consume any alcoholic beverages on any premises licensed under this article between the hours of 2 a.m. and 6 a.m. on any day of the week or at any time on Sunday between 2 a.m. and 8 a.m.

Subject to paragraph (3) of this subsection, it is lawful for a licensee in Cecil County to sell alcoholic beverages authorized by its license on Sunday during the following hours:
For a Class A, B, BLX, OR C license, between 8 a.m. and 2 a.m. the following day; and
For a Class D license, between 1 p.m. and 2 a.m. the following day.

Except for a holder of a Class BLX, EF, OR C beer, wine and liquor license, a licensee who seeks to sell alcoholic beverages within the times allowed under paragraph (2) of this subsection must first pay an additional license fee of $500.

text.section:
For the purpose of subsection (a) of this section, "restaurant" means a business establishment for the accommodation of the public:
That is fully equipped with a proper and adequate dining room and with sufficient facilities for preparing and serving meals;
That has been approved by the Board of License Commissioners of Cecil County; and
Wherein the average annual receipts from the sale of food comprise at least 25% of the average receipts of the business.
